DONATIONS AND LEGACIES ON BEHALF OF LEGITIMACY
The legitimary who waivers the inheritance, when there is no representation, may on the disposable portion retain the donations or achieve the legacies made to him; but when there has been no express dispensation from imputation, if in order to supplement the legitimacy due to the heirs it is necessary to reduce the testamentary dispositions or donations, the allocations, made by the testator on the disposable portion which would not be subject to reduction if the legitimary accepted the inheritance, remain unaffected, and the donations and legacies made to him are reduced.
